meanings.definition: The condition of having both male and female characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The gynandromorphism of the bird was evident in its half-male, half-female plumage.
meanings.sent2: Scientists were fascinated by the gynandromorphism displayed in the butterfly species.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, his gynandromorphism outfit confused everyone!
meanings.sent4: The garden was like a canvas of gynandromorphism, with flowers displaying both male and female features.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the beauty of gynandromorphism in nature.

meanings.definition: An organism exhibiting both male and female physical traits.
meanings.sent1: The rare bird was a perfect example of gynandromorphism with its unique physical features.
meanings.sent2: The biologist studied the gynandromorphism in the fish population of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The gynandromorphism of the cat made it the talk of the neighborhood!
meanings.sent4: The garden was a living example of gynandromorphism, with plants showing dual physical traits.
meanings.sent5: The museum had a special exhibit showcasing the wonders of gynandromorphism in animals.

meanings.sent1: The researcher focused on the gynandromorphism of insects in their study.
